item.name: Introduced in House
item.text:
Rapid Response Pilot Act of 2018

This bill requires the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response to award three-year grants to up to three state or local emergency medical systems for the purpose of studying system response times and the best ways to obtain such information.

bill.title: Rapid Response Pilot Act of 2018

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

item.title: To establish a pilot program for emergency medical systems, and for other purposes.

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 102 (Tuesday, June 19, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. TORRES:H.R. 6154.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:According to Article 1: Section 8: Clause 18: of theUnited States Constitution, seen below, this bill fallswithin the Constitutional Authority of the United StatesCongress.Article 1: Section 8: Clause 18: To make all Laws whichshall be necessary and proper for carrying into Execution theforegoing Powers, and all other Powers vested by thisConstitution in the Government of the United States, or inany Department or Officer thereof.[Page H5286]

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
